questions.question: What is recursion in computer programming?
options: A technique where a function calls itself.
A loop that executes a set number of times.
A method for storing data in a linear structure.
A process of creating multiple threads.
questions.answer: A technique where a function calls itself.

questions.question: Which of the following is a necessary component of a recursive function?
options: Multiple base cases
Recursive case only
Base case
Iteration

questions.question: What problem is commonly solved using recursion?
options: Creating graphical user interfaces
Network packet routing
Sorting algorithms
Memory management

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a base case in recursion?
options: The condition under which a recursive function ends.
The maximum number of times a function can call itself.
The initial parameters passed to a recursive function.
A specific version of the function for error handling.
questions.answer: The condition under which a recursive function ends.

questions.question: Recursion can be used for which of the following applications?
options: Improving database performance
Designing network protocols
Solving puzzles like Tower of Hanoi
Enhancing the speed of the CPU
questions.answer: Solving puzzles like Tower of Hanoi
